contextId.occurrenceNote: The stone is referred to as if it is a person who can see. Alternate translation: "The great stone ... is still there, and people remember what happened on it" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-personification]])
contextId.glQuote: The great stone ... remains a witness

contextId.occurrenceNote: Here Samuel speaks of Saul's hand as if it were a person trying to find things. Alternate translation: "do whatever you think is right to do" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-personification]])
contextId.glQuote: do whatever your hand finds to do

contextId.occurrenceNote: Samuel speaks as if the Spirit of Yahweh were a person running up to Saul and taking complete control of him. See how you translated this in [1 Samuel 10:6](../10/06.md). Alternate translation: "the Spirit of Yahweh took complete control of him" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-personification]])
contextId.glQuote: the Spirit of God rushed upon him

contextId.occurrenceNote: The swords are spoken of as if they were living people. Alternate translation: "The Philistine soldiers were striking each other with their swords" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-personification]])
contextId.glQuote: Every Philistine's sword was against his fellow countrymen
